Race.SpecificTitle: Council Member at Large -- City of Port Allen
PW Parish Council (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizing an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of West Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption (in addition to the homestead exemption authorized under the provisions of Article VII, Section 20 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended (the "Louisiana Constitution"), which applies to the first $7,500 of the assessed valuation of property), be authorized on the next $7,500 of assessed valuation of property receiving the homestead exemption, with respect to property owned and occupied by a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of 100% by the United States Department of Veteran Affairs, and their surviving spouse, on property located in the Parish of West Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses shall extend and apply to property in the Parish of West Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of the Parish of West Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sunday Alcohol Sales -- Sunday Sales - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Sunday Alcohol Sales Proposition

Summary:  Requiring the Parish Council of the Parish of West Baton Rouge to amend Chapter 6, Section 23(2) and Chapter 6, Section 116(2) of the Compiled Ordinances of the Parish of West Baton Rouge, for the purpose of prohibiting the sale of all alcoholic beverages and the closure of the business selling alcoholic beverages on Sundays at 10:00 p.m. until 6:00 a.m. on Monday, provided that the 10:00 p.m. Sunday closing time shall not apply to Super Bowl Sundays, a Sunday which is followed by either Memorial Day, Labor Day, the 4th of July or New Year's Day, or if the Sunday is the 4th of July, and providing that restaurants, grocery stores, drugstores, off-track betting parlors and truck stop casinos may remain open and may sell alcoholic beverages and/or permit the consumption of alcoholic beverages in such place of business during the prohibited periods set forth above.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish Council of the Parish of West Baton Rouge be required to amend Chapter 6, Section 23(2) and Chapter 6, Section 116(2) of the Compiled Ordinances of the Parish of West Baton Rouge to provide that the sale of all alcoholic beverages must stop and the business selling such alcoholic beverages shall be closed on Sundays at 10:00 p.m. and may not reopen until 6:00 a.m. on Monday, provided that the 10:00 p.m. Sunday closing time shall not apply to Super Bowl Sundays, a Sunday which is followed by either Memorial Day, Labor Day, the 4th of July or New Year's Day, or if the Sunday is the 4th of July, and further providing that restaurants, grocery stores, drugstores, off-track betting parlors and truck stop casinos may remain open and may sell alcoholic beverages and/or permit the consumption of alcoholic beverages in such place of business during the prohibited periods set forth above?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Port Allen -- Sunday Sales - Mayor & CC
Race.SummaryText:
City of Port Allen Proposition

Summary:  Requiring the Mayor and the City Council of the City of Port Allen to amend the Code of Ordinances of the City of Port Allen, for the purpose of prohibiting the sale of all alcoholic beverages and the closure of the business
selling alcoholic beverages on Sundays at 10:00 p.m. until 6:00 a.m. on Monday, provided that the 10:00 p.m. Sunday closing time shall not apply to Super Bowl Sundays, a Sunday which is followed by either Memorial Day, Labor Day, the 4th of July or New Year's Day, or if the Sunday is the 4th of July, and providing that restaurants, grocery stores, drugstores, off-track betting parlors, if any, and truck stop casinos, if any, may remain open and may sell alcoholic beverages and/or permit the consumption of alcoholic beverages in such place of business during the prohibited periods set forth above.
Race.FullText: Shall the Mayor and the City Council of the City of Port Allen be required to amend the Code of Ordinances of the City of Port Allen to provide that the sale of all alcoholic beverages must stop and the business selling such alcoholic beverages shall be closed on Sundays at 10:00 p.m. and may not reopen until 6:00 am. on Monday, provided that the 10:00 p.m. Sunday closing time shall not apply to Super Bowl Sundays, a Sunday which is followed by either Memorial Day, Labor Day, the 4th of July or New Year's Day, or if the Sunday is the 4th of July, and further providing that restaurants, grocery stores, drugstores, off-track betting parlors, if any, and truck stop casinos, if any, may remain open and may sell alcoholic beverages and/or permit the consumption of alcoholic beverages in such place of business during the prohibited periods set forth above?
